meanings.definition: A person or animal that sets the pace in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: The pacers in the marathon led the runners through the course.
meanings.sent2: During the swimming competition, the pacers swam ahead to guide the others.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could be the pacer.
meanings.sent4: In the relay race, each team had a strong pacer to start the competition.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah served as the ultimate pacer, setting a record-breaking speed.

meanings.definition: A device used to regulate the speed of a horse or other animal.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a pacer to control the horse's pace while plowing the field.
meanings.sent2: The jockey adjusted the pacer to ensure the horse maintained a steady speed.
meanings.sent3: The pacer clicked softly, guiding the horse along the path.
meanings.sent4: With the help of the pacer, the carriage moved smoothly along the road.
meanings.sent5: The trainer relied on the pacer to keep the horse at a consistent pace.

meanings.definition: A basketball team based in Indianapolis, Indiana.
meanings.sent1: The Pacers played a thrilling game against their rivals last night.
meanings.sent2: Fans cheered loudly as the Pacers scored a winning basket.
meanings.sent3: The Pacers practiced diligently to improve their teamwork on the court.
meanings.sent4: Despite the tough competition, the Pacers emerged victorious.
meanings.sent5: The Pacers' coach motivated the team to give their best performance.
